title: Steve Bannon found guilty
'Shocked': Gay senator confronted Rubio as he called bill 'stupid waste of time' in elevator
description: Sen. Marco Rubio (R-FL) told CNN that a vote on a bill to codify same-sex marriage was a "stupid waste of time" as he was walking into an elevator where Sen. Tammy Baldwin (D-WI), who is gay, was in. She talks to CNN's Jake Tapper about her response.

title: CEO of world's second-largest car maker steps down in surprise move
description: Volkswagen's CEO is leaving his post in a surprise move, effective September 1.

title: China braces for an even hotter weekend as temperatures climb
Must-watch videos of the week
Rise in gasoline prices threatens social stability and food security in Latin America
description: South American countries are bracing for an autumn of discontent, as spiking global fuel prices threaten to provoke more protests in the upcoming months.

title: Biden's Covid-19 symptoms were still mild as of late Thursday night, top White House adviser says
description: President Joe Biden's Covid-19 symptoms remained mild as of late Thursday and he continues to convalesce at the White House, a top adviser told CNN on Friday.

title: World's starving populations depend on the deal
description: After months of fears over global food supplies following Russia's invasion of Ukraine in February, a deal to unblock the transport of Ukrainian grain has just been signed in Turkey.

title: Linda Evangelista settles cosmetic procedure lawsuit
description: Former supermodel Linda Evangelista says she has settled a lawsuit over cosmetic procedures which she claimed ruined her career.

title: Steve Bannon expresses frustration outside courtroom
description: Steve Bannon spoke to reporters and expressed his frustration outside the courtroom of his criminal contempt of Congress trial Thursday. CNN's Sara Murray reports.

title: Ticket prices for Bruce Springsteen's shows are angering some fans
description: Paying for some Bruce Springsteen tickets these days may be "Tougher Than The Rest."

title: How Trump chose not to act on Jan. 6
Opinion: A very European answer to air conditioning
description: American friends visiting my downtown Berlin apartment at the height of summer always guffaw at my rinky-dink plastic fan, propped up on a bookshelf above my desk.

title: Italian thieves return watch to victim after realizing it was fake
description: They say hospitality in Naples is second to none, and one tourist got a singular experience of the Italian city when thieves robbed him of his watch at gunpoint -- then brought it back when they realized it was fake.

title: Boston officer, once beaten by colleagues, is now the new boss
description: CNN interviews Michael Cox, Boston's new police commissioner. Cox's colleagues beat him years ago after mistaking him for a suspect. Now, the native Bostonian is poised to lead one of the largest police forces in the country.

title: 'He chose not to act. Same review he got for 'Home Alone 2':' Colbert takes aim at Trump's inaction on Jan. 6
description: The "Late Show" host joked about former President Donald Trump's refusal to act during the insurrection at the US Capitol in the show's latest episode, which aired live after the eighth day of the January 6 hearings.

title: Meet the rare and mysterious Patagonian ice dragon that lives on rapidly disappearing glaciers
description: A mysterious tiny dragon lives among the ice of the Andes Mountains in South America -- and if you blink, you might just miss it.

title: Why a social media app is dragging the market lower
description: An average 347 million people use Snapchat every day. That's a fraction of the nearly 2 billion daily active users on Facebook, its biggest competitor.

title: Sanjay Gupta explains how scientists are trying to 'outsmart cancer'
description: CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta reports on how scientists have found ways that mRNA vaccines may be helpful in cancer treatment.

title: How to socialize, date and have fun while staying sober or drinking less
description: Backyard barbecues, summer weddings, back-on-again festivals and overdue catch-ups: The social calendar is back in full swing after more than two years of pandemic-related lockdowns and restrictions.

title: Hear Cheney's question to GOP about Trump during her closing statement
description: Former Obama adviser David Axelrod asks conservative commentator Scott Jennings, who voted for Trump twice, if he'd do so again after all of the evidence presented by the Jan. 6 select committee.

title: 'Anything's Possible' marks Billy Porter's directing debut with a teen trans love story
description: Marking Billy Porter's film directing debut, "Anything's Possible" is a sensitive high-school love story that's so light on conflict as to risk blowing away. Placing a trans teen at its center adds some heft to material that would in an earlier era would have been presented as an after-school special, but the uplifting and timely messaging can't completely elevate this earnest but thin Amazon movie.

title: Twitter says 'uncertainty' with Elon Musk is hurting its business
description: Twitter's battle with Elon Musk is weighing on its business.

title: How to finally get through your to-do list
description: Most of us make to-do lists to keep track of all the things we need to tackle around the house, to keep our families running and to stay on top of tasks at work.

title: Germany bails out its biggest natural gas importer
description: The German government has stepped in to bail out one of its biggest energy companies — the latest casualty of Europe's natural gas crisis.

title: Selma Blair wants a cameo appearance in 'Legally Blonde 3'
description: Actress Selma Blair says she is hoping to "at least make a cameo" in "Legally Blonde 3."

title: The proxy fight between Trump and Pence continues with Arizona rallies
description: Former President Donald Trump and former vice president Mike Pence are set to hold dueling events Friday in Arizona, turning the state's upcoming Republican primary for governor into a proxy fight between the two former allies as they inch toward what could be a 2024 showdown.

title: Women's Euro 2022: Germany through to semifinals with 2-0 win against Austria
description: Germany's vastly experienced captain and star striker Alexandra Popp is featuring in her first ever Women's Euro after missing the 2013 and 2017 tournaments due to injury.

title: David Ojabo: From Nigeria to Aberdeenshire to second round NFL draft pick
description: David Ojabo hangs up his phone and lets out a guttural roar of relief and joy.

title: Sadio Mané and Asisat Oshoala win African Player of the Year awards
description: Senegal's Sadio Mané and Nigeria's Asisat Oshoala were crowned African Footballers of the Year -- both scoring consecutive wins at the awards, which were held in Rabat, Morocco.

title: Shericka Jackson and Noah Lyles both smash 200m sprint records at World Championships
description: It was a spectacular night of sprinting at the World Championships on Thursday as records tumbled in both the men's and women's 200m finals.

title: Gunfire heard at main Mali military base, residents suspect militant attack
description: Heavy gunfire was heard early on Friday at the main military base outside Mali's capital Bamako before easing after about an hour, in what residents of the camp said they believed was an attack by Islamist militants.

title: Boom Supersonic unveils new design for Overture supersonic jet
description: It's been almost 20 years since Concorde flew for the final time.

title: History-making chef Fatmata Binta is giving the world a taste of nomadic food culture
description: Fatmata Binta has lived in many places throughout her life, but no matter where she is, food is always her home. Her passion for cooking began when she was just five years old.

title: An accidental master: The rise of legendary golf photographer David Cannon
description: With his surname, you could say that David Cannon was predestined for a career behind the lens.

title: Australia's largest music festival sinks into the mud forcing first day cancellation
description: Australia's largest music festival has turned into a mud pit, forcing organizers to cancel the first day of acts as concertgoers complained of quagmires and flooded tents.

title: Here today, gone tomorrow: China's vanishing livestreamers
description: One month ago, Li Jiaqi disappeared from the internet.

title: Desperation and hope drive migrants onto 'boats of death' in Tunisia
description: A photograph of Fadi's smiling face is emblazoned on his mother's t-shirt. The then-20-year-old is pictured standing near the shores of the Mediterranean Sea in Tunisia.

title: Sri Lankan troops tear down protest camp outside the President's office
description: Sri Lanka's police and military troops forcibly removed anti-government protesters camped outside the presidential office in Colombo in a pre-dawn raid on Friday on the order of the country's new President.

title: Russia's ability to spy in Europe cut in half, MI6 chief says
How Fat Girls Hiking brought more women into the outdoors
description: In 2016, Playboy Playmate Dani Mathers was at a Los Angeles gym when she Snapchatted a picture in the locker room, of herself pointing and laughing at an older woman. Mathers shared a photo of the woman's naked body with the caption "If I can't unsee this then you can't either."
